messages.title: Why Frack when we can Invest in Secure Jobs and a Brighter Future?
messages.content: Helen Grayshan, Green candidate for Dundee East, has called for a total ban on Fracking in Scotland.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Helen Grayshan supports a total ban on Fracking in Scotland and calls for investment in clean energy sources instead.
Argues for direct investment in clean, secure jobs through renewable energy development, asserting North East Scotland's potential as a global energy centre.
Public services must be kept safe in public hands and not run for private profit; emphasis on supporting local communities and providing better services.
Advocates for the minimum wage to become a living wage to take dignity away from workers.

issues.economy: Remarks on the need to rebalance the economy with an emphasis on sustainability and supporting local communities.
issues.environment: Calls for investment in secure jobs through renewable energy and a total ban on Fracking.
issues.governance: Mentions providing better public services and governance that works for everyone, criticizing the pursuit of profit over people.

leaflet.personalStatement: Pauline Hinchion, Green candidate for Dundee West said: 'Parties tell you vote for us to keep the others out' - but their policies are very similar. Fresh ideas and real change are what is needed now.
leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet also discusses the opposition to TTIP and criticizes the burning of fossil fuels.
